WRFmet.Rmd

Loading WRF Data

Loading WRF data can be easily done using WRFmet’s wrf_load function. This function accesses WRF model run files …[in progress]…

[Explain WRF data dir]

library(WRFmet)

# raster <- wrf_load(
#   modelName = ...,
#   modelRun = ...,
#   modelMode = ...,
#   vars = c('HGT', 'TSK'),
#   res = 0.1
# )

You can also load in existing WRF NetCDF files from anywhere on your machine by specifying the localPath argument in wrf_load(). For example:

raster <- wrf_load(
  localPath = '~/Data/WRF/wrfout_d3-2020071512-f07-0000.nc',
  vars = c('HGT', 'TSK'),
  res = 0.1
)

Plotting WRF Data

WRFmet provides several preset plot types for visualizing raster, vector, and spatial point/polygon data. These include:

…

These plots are preset combinations of various building-block “layers”. Custom plots can be built by stacking these layers which function similar to GGPlot’s geom_* elements. This process is covered in further detail in the “Static Layered Plots” article.
